overview:
About the Position

As a member of the Accounting team, you will primarily be focused on coordinating and accounting for the Company's members’ capital and related accounts.

Responsibilities:

  • General ledger entries and monthly closings for capital and related accounts.
  • Prepare and review quarterly statements for members / investors.
  • Communicate quarterly estimates to member / investor accountants.
  • Prepare and coordinate all investment documentation as well as tracking investment data / performance.
  • Assist with capital projections and analyses.
  • Prepare supporting schedules for external auditors.
  • Prepare annual income and capital work papers for tax.
  • Adhering to company’s internal controls and procedures.
  • Ensure members’ financial records are meticulously maintained, controlled, and safeguarded and ensure proper execution of agreements.

About You

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business or a related field.
  • 5-8 years Accounting and/or Finance related experience. Experience with financial reporting, statement preparation preferred.
  • Proficient with MS Excel.
  • Solid analytical and research skills.
  • Detail oriented with strong organizational skills.
  • Ability to handle competing priorities and to work effectively in a challenging, fast-paced environment.
  • Mature, trustworthy, and discreet, with an understanding of and appreciation for the importance of confidentiality in this role.
  • Self-motivated with strong interpersonal skills, both verbal and written, with proven ability to build relationships.

About the Position

Jane Street offers institutional clients direct access to the firm’s liquidity through our client-focused sales and trading team. Using our extensive product knowledge, we take a collaborative approach with our clients to develop the optimal execution strategy for their specific need.

We are currently hiring for a sales-trader role. This role is both externally facing, supporting clients day-to-day trading needs, and also internally focused, accessing liquidity from Jane Street's bond trading desk.

Overview

  • Assist any client issues that may arise throughout the cycle of the trade
  • Support the client-facing bonds business, including trade execution/booking
  • Establish an understanding of the nature and needs of our clients’ varying business practices and regularly provide relevant market insight, product information and sales support
  • Consult clients on best trading practices. This includes pre-trade analysis, facilitating execution of trades and post-trade analysis
  • Contribute to daily client-facing tasks including collating market color and general sales calls
    Contribute to building and maintaining relationship with clients and other market participants (including conferences and client entertaining)
  • Assist in the continuous improvements for the bond desk’s trade execution, booking, and other downstream experience
  • Assist in building and maintaining relationships with clients
  • Liaise with operations desk to deal with trade/settlement/corporate actions issues
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of Jane Street’s trading expertise and our execution service’s features and benefits
  • Support a team that both prospects new clients for Jane Street as well as provides sales coverage and execution strategies for existing clients

About You

  • Proficient financial technology including Bloomberg and excel
  • Organized and professional with a strong attention to detail
  • VBA experience a plus
  • MarketAxess, Tradeweb knowledge a plus
  • 3+ years of sales trading experience
  • Experience covering institutional clients
  • Engaging personality & strong communication skills

About the Position

Jane Street is looking for a business development associate to join our marketing and external engagement team. This role involves collaborating across the organization to synthesize and present the firm’s data and research. Success in this role will involve working closely with global product marketing and business development to help carry out key projects, including assisting with internal consulting engagements, strategic planning, as well as gathering and analyzing trading and market data, and supporting our overall global initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Work with business leads to identify global market trends and client requests.
  • Conduct research and analysis including synthesizing sales and trading information and industry trends to develop client materials and relevant thought leadership.
  • Research and monitor industry research reports, media, and client inquiries in order to anticipate and create innovative content and programming for external engagement.
  • Work with traders and client services in the US/EU and Asia to develop relevant and compelling content to be used across multiple mediums (e.g. webpages, client presentations, and digital content).

About You

  • 2-4 years of experience within management consulting.
  • Strong proficiency in PowerPoint and Excel with the ability to synthesize and present data.
  • Hard working and eager to learn in a fast paced, collaborative and intellectual environment.
  • Experience with writing and communications.
  • Well-organized and detail-oriented.
  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
  • A bachelor’s degree is required.

About the Position

The Business Development Team sits at the intersection of our trading, technology, operations, and compliance teams. Projects will involve analyzing complex documents and data sets from various sources, and communicating relevant findings to different internal groups. You will also work with members of your team and others to identify bottlenecks in current processes, brainstorm solutions, and implement new business initiatives. Many projects will also require you to streamline existing procedures to facilitate continuity across Jane Street’s business areas. Through frequent, open discussions in a highly collaborative environment, you’ll have the opportunity to learn how a trading firm develops, responds, and evolves in competitive global markets.

About You

We’re looking for a thoughtful, proactive rising senior/penultimate year graduate (class of 2021) who takes an analytical approach to multi-layered problems. You should be self-motivated, organized, careful, and detail-oriented. You’ll be expected to exercise good judgment as well as advanced time-management, project-management, and interpersonal skills. You are numerate, computer-literate, and proficient with Excel and VBA (or willing to learn).

If this position sounds interesting but you're looking for a full-time opportunity please consider our Infrastructure Rotational Program, listed under our open Infrastructure positions.

About the Position

We are looking for a Client Operations Specialist. The position sits within the sales trading team providing coverage to a cross section of institutional clients from asset managers to private banks, insurance companies, pension funds, etc. The role combines client facing responsibilities with project and process management duties. The candidate should be comfortable interacting with members of various internal teams and should be a detail-oriented self-starter.

  • Work transparently, to the highest ethical and trustworthy standards.
  • Facilitate communication between sales and operations teams. Whilst working on the sales and sales trading desk, forge strong relationships with the operations team to understand their processes, tools and challenges.
  • Act as point of escalation for customers raising day-to-day settlement issues related to Jane Street’s institutional client trading business.
  • Work closely with sales and operations teams to preemptively identify problems related to trade settlements with key client accounts.
  • Monitor general quality of settlement process of trades related to Jane Street’s client business. Design, run and analyse periodic and ad-hoc reports.
  • Propose systematic solutions to recurring issues. Act as a Project Manager when such work is needed to address those problems.
  • Represent Jane Street during regular and ad-hoc broker review meetings with relation to settlement quality and operations topics.

About You

  • University educated, with strong Excel skills. VBA is a plus.
  • Relevant experience in a similar role (e.g., Operations, Trade Support, Trading Desk Assistant).
  • Strong understanding of settlement processes and regulations.
  • Ability to systematically address problems – any project management experience a plus.
  • Positive attitude and presence.
  • Reliable, courteous, and flexible team player.
  • Self-motivated with strong organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills.
  • Fluency in another European language is a plus (French, Italian, Spanish or German preferred).

About the Position

This position will support Jane Street’s client-facing trading business, and consists of a mix of operational and project-oriented work.


The operational side of the job is focused on monitoring the health of Jane Street’s client-facing trading infrastructure, and working with the trading desks and technology groups to understand and react to issues as they arise during the trading day. Additionally, the person in this role will assist external clients by acting as a first point of contact for technical questions, data queries, and troubleshooting. Quick thinking and effective communication are important parts of this job.

About You


When not on the support rotation, engineers will work on projects to improve the trading infrastructure, such as:

  • Writing code to improve the stack of tools and systems for managing, monitoring, and configuring Jane Street’s trading infrastructure.
  • Working with Trading Systems developers to improve Jane Street's client-facing trading infrastructure.
  • Onboarding new clients onto Jane Street's trading systems.

About the Position

As Jane Street grows, the quality of the development tools we use matters more and more. We increasingly work on the OCaml compiler itself: adding useful language features, fine-tuning the type system and improving the performance of the generated code. Alongside this, we also work on the surrounding toolchain, developing new tools for profiling, debugging, documentation and build automation.

About You

We're looking to hire a developer with experience working on compilers to join us. That experience might be from working on a production compiler in industry or from working on research compilers in an academic setting. No previous experience with OCaml or functional programming languages is required.

About the Position

Jane Street’s key to success is its employees; we work hard to create and maintain an amazing office environment whereby our employees feel happy and have the tools needed to do a great job. The Conference Coordinator together with the rest of the Office Admin team are central to making this a reality.

Our new conference floor in our NYC headquarters building will comprise 65,000 sq. ft. of space including a main reception area, 48 meeting rooms, auditorium, classroom, gym, medical suite, mother’s rooms, full kitchen and several coffee pantries. The Conference Coordinator will provide operational oversight of the meeting and events spaces and assure all spaces are functioning well and are meticulously maintained.

Specifically, this person will:

  • Work cross functionally with teams in recruiting, events, marketing, sales, tech facilities and office administration to plan and execute successful on-site meetings and events on this floor.
  • Book conference rooms, board rooms, and training rooms for internal and external meetings and events.
  • Support, mentor, and guide our Front of House reception team.
  • Be the face of Jane Street in our reception and hospitality area.
  • Develop and implement standard operating procedures regarding service delivery and hospitality.
  • Take an active role in managing our physical spaces to ensure they are clean, orderly, and up to our high standards.
  • Investigate and evaluate new room-booking tools and other emerging technologies.
  • Assist the team with the furniture layouts and set ups as required to meet the needs of the firm.

About You

  • A four year college degree.
  • 5-7 years relevant experience working in hospitality operations, hotels and/or conference center management.
  • Proven ability to build, manage, motivate and mentor diverse teams of people.
  • Ability to balance the strategic planning of the work with a willingness to roll up your sleeve and do what it takes to get the job done.
  • A strategic thinker and self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit .
  • Ability to solve problems and make clear-headed decisions while under pressure.
  • Great customer service orientation with an innate desire to be of assistance and address varying, sometimes conflicting requests.
  • Reliable, courteous, and flexible team player able to work a schedule that may include early morning and evening hours.
  • Strong interpersonal skills / EQ with the ability to build relationships across the firm.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent organizational skills with ability to follow through on outstanding issues in an independent manner.

About the Position

We're looking to add full-time, passionate cybersecurity engineers to our Hong Kong office who want to help our efforts to protect our company's people, data, and infrastructure from the wilds of the internet. Our cybersecurity engineers work on firm-wide defenses, provide expertise and advice to other groups, lead employee cybersecurity awareness efforts, and handle some of the event analysis and incident response responsibilities of the firm. We're looking for people who have a strong technical foundation, who are not afraid to build something themselves, who bring good taste to solving security problems, and who can reason about and effectively explain the 'why' behind security practices. Strong scripting is a minimum, programming a plus.

About You

  • Junior to Experienced - You are in college looking for your first job, or have years of experience.
  • Tapped into cybersecurity developments - You follow cybersecurity news and developments, but can tell the difference between the latest cool hack by security researchers and what actually matters in your day-to-day.
  • Scripting or programming and surrounding practices - You have interest and ability to automate in a real programming language, ability and desire to manage your code and configs in version control, and knowledge of your editor (we don't care which though)
  • Measured response - Not everyone should be locking their entire lives down in the name of security. You can discuss tradeoffs when it comes to cybersecurity, think about context, and understand what threat modeling is.
  • Understand and practice good personal cybersecurity hygiene, and can talk to others about it.
    • For example: You know what a password manager is, and either use one or have something which you can reasonable argue is better (airgap?) and can walk someone through the tradeoffs you've made. Seriously, we're going to ask you about this sort of thing during the interview process.
  • A positive and collaborative attitude - You understand that a key component of cybersecurity is bringing others along with you on the journey

We're looking to add full-time, passionate cybersecurity engineers to our New York office who want to help our efforts to protect our company's people, data, and infrastructure from the wilds of the internet. Our cybersecurity engineers work on firm-wide defenses, provide expertise and advice to other groups, lead employee cybersecurity awareness efforts, and handle some of the event analysis and incident response responsibilities of the firm. We're looking for people who have a strong technical foundation, who are not afraid to build something themselves, who bring good taste to solving security problems, and who can reason about and effectively explain the 'why' behind security practices. Strong scripting is a minimum, programming a plus.

For example: You know what a password manager is, and either use one or have something which you can reasonable argue is better (airgap?) and can walk someone through the tradeoffs you've made. Seriously, we're going to ask you about this sort of thing during the interview process.
  • A positive and collaborative attitude - You understand that a key component of cybersecurity is bringing others along with you on the journey.

About the Position

Jane Street is searching for a designer to join the Marketing team. The person in this role will develop marketing material primarily for our Institutional Services group but also for the firm at large. Projects will include presentation design, report and one-pager styling, icon development, booth design, event swag, and other print and digital material. Jane Street’s design thrives on curious digging and an ability to make conceptual connections in unexpected places and bring them to life. Being excited to try new things and being able to ask great questions of colleagues and work with them through concept and design are key to this role.

About You

  • Strong proficiency in PowerPoint, Excel, Illustrator and InDesign.
  • 5-7 years of related design experience.
  • Flexible, willing to iterate through collaboration and present a wide aesthetic range.
  • A bachelor’s degree is required.
  • Knowledge of the financial services industry a plus.

About the Position

Members of the Windows administration group work with others in the broader Systems group to monitor and maintain a mixed Windows and Linux environment spread across a physical and virtual computing landscape on three continents. Windows administrators play a crucial role in ensuring that we can meet our core business goals 24 hours a day, six days a week.

Desktop support specialists focus on providing technical support for users of our automated and manual trading environments, consisting of a combination of in-house and third-party applications. To this end, we work closely with colleagues in the Linux and network administration groups to closely monitor a vast array of systems and troubleshoot problems in real-time. Desktop support specialists also work to improve overall efficiency by better understanding users' problems, suggesting and implementing solutions along the way.

About You

  • Solid foundation in computer science and networking principles
  • Technical strength in networking, programming, or system administration
  • Knowledge and training in Windows Desktop/Server Operating Systems and best practices in a production environment
  • Working knowledge of Active Directory, Group Policy and other common Windows administration sub-systems
  • Efficiently diagnose, troubleshoot, and resolve technical issues at desktop, server, and network level
  • Ability to analyze and deconstruct technical problems
  • Ability to communicate clearly and effectively
  • Help document procedures and develop KB articles for use by the Tech community and staff
  • Ability to support a diverse, technical end-user environment
  • Familiarity with the Linux operating system and computing environment
  • Ability to write clear code in at least one programming language such as Powershell, C#, Python, F#, or OCaml. Experience with a functional language is not required

About the Position:

Technology is a key component of Jane Street’s core business. Desktop Support works within the larger IT group to monitor and maintain a mixed Windows and Linux environment spread across a physical and virtual computing landscape on three continents. Desktop Support Engineer Interns provide support to end users, assist with Move-Add-Change (MAC) projects, and help develop and write internal tooling for IT Support. Jane Street is a highly collaborative environment and intern projects lead to exposure across other business units in trading and technology.

About You:

The ideal candidate is in the class of 2020 or 2021, a self-starter, comfortable in a fast-paced environment, ready to roll up their sleeves and learn. We encourage new ideas and real-time feedback to better support our firm. As a Desktop Support Engineer Intern, your tasks and responsibilities would include, but are not limited to:

  • Provide hands-on support to end-users.
  • Assist with technology projects related to Move/Add/Change requests and infrastructure expansion.
  • Develop and maintain technical documentation.
  • Attend a mix of finance theory and technology classes to gain exposure to other technology groups in Jane Street.

About the Position

We're looking to hire a strongly motivated individual who is excited to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment. This person will have a strong fundamental trading background in oil and/or products and work with our team to research new strategies that incorporate fundamental views into our existing energy trading.

About You

  • 4+ years of professional experience in trading energy (oil or products) based off fundamentals.
  • Comfortable working in a team environment.
  • Strong analytical capabilities.
  • Knowledge of oil physical/financial markets.
  • Proficiency in statistics.
  • Coding skills a plus.

About the Position

We are looking for an experienced professional to support Jane Street's traders with securities finance expertise. The role is an entrepreneurial one: the remit is broad in terms of touch points across the firm, and we expect the candidate to be able to work seamlessly with our front office as well as our back office. The role offers the opportunity to assist the firm with long-term strategic development, in addition to helping our traders with immediate trading decisions. The role will draw on experience and relationships in the equity financing market and be part of a growing global portfolio finance team.

  • Learn and understand the firm's financing infrastructure.
  • Help build efficiency in securities lending and financing processes across the firm.
  • Use street-side relationships to help diversify and optimize Jane Street's borrowing resources.
  • Keep the treasury/finance teams abreast of any changes in the market or regulatory landscape that require action.
  • Work with the trading desks to assist in putting together trades and trade ideas.
  • Work with the trading team to ensure our partnership with prime brokers is optimized in terms of efficiency and bottom line returns.
  • Work with operations and infrastructure to build reporting and monitoring tools for position-level financing rates.

About You

  • 5+ years of related experience in equity financing at a sell-side or buy-side firm.
  • An ability to develop and add to relationships with prime brokers and clearing firms.
  • Strong coding/excel skills are a plus.
  • Self-motivator who can help build a platform capable of supporting our growth.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to learn and understand new trading strategies.
  • Able to work well in a team environment.

About the Position

The IT ERP Program Manager will drive the project management process for key business applications. This role will support critical business needs and help identify opportunities and operational optimizations for our technical and infrastructure operations.

This individual will take the lead in defining, measuring, communicating, and executing all program deliverables to key stakeholders, project team members and our management team. In addition, you will own the requirements gathering and prioritization process for implementing our new firm-wide ERP.

You will be involved with budgeting, capacity planning and execution of the project plan in all phases from requirements gathering to final deliverables and ongoing support.

Oversee third-party vendors. Hold them accountable to schedules, deliverables and quality of work across key phases: design, build, test, deploy, support.

About You

  • Subject-Matter-Expert level experience in deploying an Enterprise-wide ERP system such as a Workday/Oracle/ADP/Sybase or similar product is required.
  • A PMP certification is highly desired.
  • 4-10+ years of experience in Project or Program Management.
  • Experience managing the delivery of a new or transformational product.
  • Highly proficient in using data visualization, developer and data analytic tools such as Tableau (or similar), Jira and Excel.
  • Ability to effectively manage multiple projects in parallel.
  • Experience in the financial industry is a plus.
  • Team-oriented with excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

About the Position

Jane Street’s key to success is its employees and we work hard to create and maintain an amazing office environment where our employees feel happy, engaged in their work and are excited about opportunities to connect with their colleagues. Our Events Coordinator will be an indispensable part of that effort, planning and executing events for employees, interns and university recruits which meet our firm-wide objectives and enhance our culture.

Responsibilities include:

  • Working with the New York team to develop event strategy and best practices for event execution.

  • Building relationships across the firm to understand Jane Street’s culture and employee population.

  • Organizing events from start to finish including but not limited to venue selection, catering, entertainment, transportation, promotion, RSVP management and onsite event day support.

  • Maintaining a database of all event details and costs.

  • Sharing best practices with event organizers in Jane Street’s overseas offices.

  • Working with the legal department on all event related contracts.

About you

  • University degree preferred.

  • A minimum of 3 years of experience planning and executing events.

  • Willingness to handle all aspects of the event from planning to on-site execution.

  • Knowledge of the London events market with a professional network that can be tapped for information.

  • Willingness to work a flexible schedule that may include early mornings and evening hours to meet the needs of the business.

  • Great customer service orientation with an innate desire to be of assistance and address varying, sometimes conflicting requests.

  • Well-developed organizational skills with the ability and desire to follow through on all outstanding issues.

  • Comfortable working in a flat corporate environment with little hierarchy.

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

  • Exceptional computer skills (Word and Excel).

About the Position

We are seeking a recruiter with a focus on lateral/experienced hiring to join the team in London. This person will help the team in executing strategies to source, identify and lead the interview process for qualified candidates, in a wide variety of areas, with a focus on Software Engineering and IT.

The successful candidate will be expected to :

  • Assume responsibility across various areas for recruitment of experienced candidates, from inception of role, to offer.
  • Build relationships and partner with hiring managers to design effective and calibrated interview processes.

  • Manage search firm relationships.
  • Seek out, develop and execute new and innovative sourcing and attraction strategies, in conjunction with the Experienced Hire recruiting team globally.
  • Facilitate all processes from interviews to hiring discussions with hiring teams.

About You

  • Significant recruiting experience (5 years +) with a focus on lateral and experienced hiring ideally with a background in Technology, Financial or Professional Services, or a related environment.
  • Exceptional organization, analytical and interpersonal skills, including a meticulous attention to detail.
  • Proactive self-starter, with a vision for effective and efficient experienced hire recruitment in the region.
  • Solid communication (both written and verbal) and relationship management skills.
  • Ability to exercise discretion and be thoughtful about internal and external communication.
  • Strong team player, with the ability to work effectively within and across various teams, and independently as appropriate.
  • Natural inclination to prioritize in a commercial manner, and keep candidates and hiring managers fully informed throughout a search.
  • Prior and relevant in house recruitment experience is beneficial.

About the Position

We are seeking a recruiter with a focus on lateral/experienced hiring to join the team in Hong Kong, and be a key member of the global team hiring candidates with prior commercial experience. This person will help the team in executing strategies to source, identify and lead the interview process for qualified candidates, in a wide variety of areas both on the trading and non-trading side of the business.

  • Take ownership of relevant candidate pipelines and continue to develop them through various sourcing methods including direct applicants, employee referrals, use of agencies when appropriate, etc.

About the Position

Jane Street’s key to success is its employees; we work hard to create and maintain an amazing office environment whereby our employees feel happy and have the tools needed to do a great job. The Facilities Coordinator, together with the Facilities team are central to making this a reality.

The Facilities Coordinator will ensure that our office space(s) and building infrastructure are functioning well and are meticulously maintained. They will also serve as a liaison between several Jane Street offices and vendors.

Specifically, this person will:

  • Conduct daily walkthrough of all floors to ensure compliance with firm standards.
  • Interface with the building cleaners and other building vendors to ensure our standards are maintained at all times.
  • Proactively provide and coordinate preventative maintenance on all the MEP systems/equipment.
  • Create and maintain a tracking system for equipment warranty and repair information.
  • Assess equipment repair/replace decisions.
  • Assist with furniture sets and resets in conference rooms, auditoriums and event spaces.
  • Occasionally oversee maintenance of the office space during off-hours and weekends.

About You

  • Experience working with vendors, contractors, and suppliers for equipment maintenance and repairs.
  • Strong computer skills and familiarity working with technical people in an IT-centric environment.
  • Willingness and ability to solve small problems in the field and be handy enough to manage without a tradesman.
  • Ability to self manage during flexible working hours, as the business requires.
  • Strategic thinker and self-starter who can operate independently and provide summary status reports to leadership and peers on the engineering team.
  • Problem solver who can make clear-headed decisions while under pressure.
  • Great customer service orientation with an innate desire to be of assistance.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and the ability to describe detailed problems with brevity and accuracy.
  • University educated or equivalent practical experience.

About the Position

We are seeking a professionally trained facilities engineer with practical problem solving skills across multiple disciplines to join the ranks and round out a highly technical group that is responsible for providing the physical infrastructure for the firm’s trading and data center environments.
Our goal is to successfully manage, design and provide highly reliable trading floors, co-location facilities, and data centers for our business.
The specific industry an individual has worked in is less important than a proven commitment to excellence, a strong team player, prior facilities experience and an ability to demonstrate well-reasoned engineering decisions.
Work will be collaborative in nature, with specific responsibilities spanning all aspects of our physical infrastructure, including: troubleshooting, fixing, and triage of issues as they arise.

About You

  • A minimum of 1-3 years of experience working in a facilities engineering capacity (specifically with systems such as: power, cooling, lighting, and furniture.)
  • Familiarity with MEP disciplines including plant infrastructure, CRACs, UPS's, office HVAC, generators, fire prevention and Building Management Systems would be an added bonus.
  • Experience working with or managing vendors, contractors, and suppliers in order to provide 24/7 support for critical infrastructure.
  • Strong computer skills and familiarity working with technical people in a tech-y environment.
  • Willingness and ability to solve small problems in the field. Candidates should be handy enough to not always need a tradesman.
  • Be part of an on-call rotation for weekends and nights and quickly respond to critical system emergencies.
  • Experience working with professionally diverse teams, and interfacing with non-engineers and multiple business units.
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills, and the ability to describe detailed problems with brevity and accuracy.

About the Position

This role involves working, in conjunction with the accounting teams both in the US and globally, to maintain the US firm’s books and records and the preparation of monthly and annual financial statements. This individual will be heavily involved in the month-end close process and the maintenance of the company’s internal books and records. This includes the preparation or involvement in various accounting reconciliations and financial schedules that support the financial statements. You will assist team members in their collaboration with outside auditors and advisors and will be involved in US GAAP interpretations, as well as accounting policy and internal control documentation and decisions.

The right candidate will be a detail-oriented self-starter who is willing to get involved and enjoys working in an intense and fast-paced work environment. Strong organizational skills and time management will contribute to success in this role. The candidate should expect and look forward to working closely with the other team members in a collaborative manner to ensure that the group’s goals are met.

About You

  • 5-8 years in an accounting background, with experience in private required
  • Solid understanding of US GAAP
  • Financial services background
  • Experience preparing and reviewing financial statements and account reconciliations
  • Proficient with MS Excel
  • Self-motivated with strong interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Detail oriented with strong organizational skills
  • Team player who is collaborative and flexible in nature
  • Ability to handle competing priorities and to work effectively in a challenging, fast-paced environment

Other desired skills:

  • Broker-dealer experience and familiarity with the relevant regulatory regimes
  • UK GAAP, IFRS, or other GAAP knowledge

About the Position

We are looking to hire an engineer with experience in both software and hardware design to work on FPGA-based applications, and on tools for creating such applications.

We're big believers in the ability of tools to make programming faster, more pleasant, and more reliable. We think the same is true for hardware design, and we're looking for people with real world experience in hardware design who are interested in using programming language technology to improve the process of designing, testing and validating hardware designs.

Day to day work will predominantly involve OCaml & Hardcaml, for both RTL design and testing/integration. Engineers will also work with some Verilog and C.

About You

This role involves working on the ground-up design and implementation of new FPGA applications, as well as helping extend and refine the high-level synthesis and testing tools that we use internally.

You don't need experience with OCaml in particular, or any experience in the financial markets, but we do want people who can approach hardware design with a software engineering mindset. A good background with some typed functional language and experience with using FPGAs in the context of Ethernet networking are both pluses.

About the Position

Jane Street’s key to success is its employees; we work hard to create and maintain an amazing office environment whereby our employees feel happy, engaged, and have the tools needed to do a great job. The Front of House Support role along with the rest of the Office Administration team are central to making this a reality. Responsibilities include:

  • Be the face of Jane Street in our reception & hospitality areas; welcome visitors/greet guests and direct appropriately while maintaining a high level of professionalism.
  • Staff the reception desk, welcome visitors and guests and direct appropriately.
  • Answer the telephone, screen and direct calls. Relay messages as needed.
  • Maintain and schedule conference room bookings. Actively manage all rooms both in the short and long term.
  • Liaise with the recruiting, events, marketing, and sales teams regarding onsite events, meeting rooms, food service, staffing, and office logistics.
  • Take an active role in managing our physical spaces to ensure they are clean, orderly, and up to our high standards, including; common areas, our rec room, gym, and terraces.
  • Assist with the furniture set-up of conference rooms for meetings.
  • Perform daily walk-through of the conference rooms to ensure they are maintained throughout the day.

About You

  • A 4-year college degree, with 2-4 years relevant work experience.
  • Great customer service skills with an innate desire to be of assistance.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent organizational skills with ability to follow through on outstanding issues in an independent manner.
  • Excellent computer skills including; GSuite, Word, and Excel.
  • Reliable, courteous, and flexible team player able to work a schedule that may include early morning and evening hours. Willingness to work a flexible schedule as needed.

About the Position

The fundamental research team develops innovative ways to overlay traditional stock analysis onto the firm’s core quantitative strategy and to expand the firm’s trading opportunities. The day to day analytic work is very diverse. We are looking for an experienced professional to join our global team of generalist analysts.
You will be responsible for:
  • Contributing to team coverage of fundamental events & special situations.
  • Precisely communicating valuation changes and investment theses to global trading teams in time sensitive environments.
  • Developing and evaluating trade ideas that involve fundamental catalysts or valuation insights.
  • Performing due diligence including valuation analysis for primary and/or secondary equity offerings.
  • Interacting with sell-side sales and research contacts globally.

About you

  • 4-8 years of relevant experience analyzing securities (Investment Banking Analyst/Associate, Equity Research Associate, Buy Side Analyst or similar).
  • Undergraduate university degree (BS/BA equivalent) or graduate work in a quantitative field is strongly preferred.
  • Effective communicator.
  • Fluency in English required, Mandarin preferred.
  • Intellectually curious.
  • Flexibility to consider intellectually rigorous but non-traditional equity trading strategies.
  • Familiarity with accounting, financial statement analysis and financial modeling.
  • Prior experience with VBA and/or SQL a plus but not required.

About the Position

Linux Engineers work with the critical infrastructure underlying the rest of the firm’s technology. Members of this group are hard-working systems engineers, administrators and programmers, tasked with maintaining and improving the platform that powers Jane Street's production trading systems. Our mix of in-house and open source software allows you to investigate and innovate at every level. On any given day, you could be debugging kernel performance, developing management tools, or resolving production issues in real time. Diving into tricky systems problems is our specialty.

Deployment automation, scalable configuration management, and obsessive monitoring are the focus of some of our ongoing projects. We automate as much of our work as we can, but not because we are lazy. We find that automation reduces our error rate and overall workload - plus, we think it's fun.

Working in our group provides opportunities for involvement with almost every other facet of the company. We work directly with colleagues in trading, technology, and operations to build and maintain systems with a firm-wide scope. Using feedback from other groups and our custom monitoring tools, we strive to resolve production issues quickly, perform comprehensive root-cause analyses, and integrate long-term fixes in a clean and robust way.

About You

We are looking to hire systems programmers and administrators with a deep knowledge of Unix internals and the Linux ecosystem. Candidates should have a willingness to learn OCaml, our language of choice, and meet the following requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or other technical discipline (or equivalent experience).
  • Clear and concise communication skills, as well as the ability to efficiently analysze and deconstruct technical problems.
  • Deep knowledge of operating system fundamentals, especially Linux.
  • Fluency with the Unix command line and shell scripting.
  • Practical experience with modern Linux systems and systems programming concepts like C, sockets, virtual memory, and the process lifecycle.
  • Basic understanding of network protocols.
  • Strong troubleshooting skills and knowledge of profiling/debugging tools such as gdb, perf, DTrace, or SystemTap.
  • Programming experience in any language (functional languages a plus).

About You

You’re as comfortable at the command-line of a *nix machine as you are in a GUI. You cherish any opportunity to take a deep dive and gain a better understanding of how the technology that most of us rely on every day works. You have practical experience with a modern *nix system, no matter whether that’s from your course-work, time spent as a systems administrator for your campus computer lab, your side projects, or something else. You like solving problems by writing code (in any language). Above all else, you are excited to learn about the tools and systems required for maintaining a complex and fast-paced production environment like ours.

The ideal candidate also has:

  • Knowledge of operating system fundamentals and computer architecture.
  • Practical experience with systems programming concepts like C, sockets, virtual memory, and the process life cycle.
  • Basic understanding of network protocols.

About the Position

This role involves working on network applications requiring extremely low latency and high throughput. Experience with fast packet processing in user space and common kernel-bypass implementations is expected (e.g. Solarflare, OpenOnload/TCPDirect/ef_vi, Exablaze, Infiniband verbs, DPDK, etc.). The right candidate is able to understand and break down application performance through hardware performance counters and other profiling tools. A thorough understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of the current X86 architecture, and experience integrating custom networking hardware, will be helpful.

About You

We build systems primarily in OCaml, with only small amounts of C and C++. But we're not looking for experience with OCaml in particular, nor do we require any financial markets experience. The most important qualification is proficiency with low level systems programming, be it in C, C++ or any other language. Understanding how to work around the performance challenges of languages with a managed runtime (such as Java, or C#), and/or familiarity with a typed functional language, would be a plus.

About the Position

Jane Street is seeking exceptional candidates for the role of Senior Machine Learning Engineer/Scientist.

Responsibilities:

  • Help lead the effort to expand and improve Jane Street's ML infrastructure and data pipeline.
  • Collaborate with teams of researchers and traders in our offices around the world to design and train ML models.
  • Invent new techniques when necessary to deal with the specific problems Jane Street works on.

About You

  • At least three years experience building ML infrastructure and production models in an industrial setting.
  • Very strong coding skills, including experience developing and deploying large software projects.
  • Deep experience with applying one or more major ML packages (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch) to very large data sets.
  • A desire to push the boundaries of ML to better deal with the problems specific to financial data including low signal-to-noise ratios and non-stationarity.
  • No finance background is necessary.

About the Position

This position offers exposure to the full production lifecycle - architecture, prototyping, implementation, monitoring and physical deployment of Jane Street’s network. Members of the network engineering group will work with other groups within the technology department to build, monitor and maintain our global network. In addition to the production environment, network engineers actively research, test, and implement new technologies and products in a constant effort to improve the reliability, performance, and usability of our network. This role is global and requires constant interaction with the network engineers and technology groups in foreign offices.

About You:

  • Ability to efficiently analyze and deconstruct technical problems.
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely.
  • Solid foundation in computer science and networking principles.
  • In depth understanding of common network protocols, best practices and the ability to apply these skills to design robust and performant networks.
  • Experience dealing with networking hardware and working familiarity with common platforms.
  • Beyond networking, technical strength in programming or system administration.
  • Willingness and ability to solve small problems in the field. You should be handy enough to not always need a tradesman.
  • Ability to be part of an on-call rotation.
  • Ability to respond to critical system emergencies.
  • The ability to describe detailed problems with brevity and accuracy.

In addition the core networking responsibilities listed above, if you can demonstrate knowledge/expertise in any of the skills below it would be a plus:

  • Linux System Administration.
  • Cisco Call Manager.
  • Firewalls and Security related products.
  • Programming, and a willingness to learn new languages.
  • Familiarity with full Data Centre design considerations, construction and maintenance life cycles. Familiarity with plant infrastructure such as CRAC's, UPS's HVAC and BMS system integration.
  • Familiarity with construction process and management.
  • Design work for trading floors.

About the Position

The person filling this role would sit within our Operations team and the be responsible for trade settlements. They will work closely with clearing firms, brokers, clients and other counterparties as well as interfacing with Jane Street teams in our other offices to ensure our post-trade processes are properly calibrated to efficiently handle our complex trade flows. The candidate should be comfortable working on a variety of tasks and interacting with members of different teams. They should be a detail-oriented self-starter.

Familiarity with industry terminology, basic trading concepts and data management technologies (e.g. VBA/SQL) are a plus but are not required. Teaching and learning are central to Jane Street’s culture and employees have access to the required training and material through classes, mentoring and discussion. The environment on this team is intense and fast-paced, so we are looking for someone bright who fits our culture and will adapt to our environment quickly, learning from day one.

About You

  • Bachelor’s Degree, including a Maths A level or equivalent.
  • At least 1 year's experience in a similar role (e.g., Operations, P&L, or Accounting).
  • Proficiency with MS Excel.
  • Positive attitude and presence.
  • Reliable, courteous, and flexible team player.
  • Self-motivated with strong organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills.

About the Position

Traders work in teams to seek out and trade on pricing inefficiencies, develop models, manage risk, investigate new products, and push into new business areas. These jobs are highly quantitative and technology driven. You should be excellent quantitatively, with a strong understanding of probability and statistics. You should be an effective communicator in a close knit team setting, motivated, competitive and eager to learn. We are interested in hiring responsible, motivated, adaptive, and logical thinkers with strong quantitative skills.

About You

  • 3-6 years options market making experience in ETF/index/equity options.
  • Quantitative background.
  • Programming experience a plus.

About the Position

We are looking for an experienced professional to support Jane Street's traders with fixed income securities finance expertise. The role is an entrepreneurial one: the remit is broad in terms of touch points across the firm, and we expect the candidate to be able to work seamlessly with our front office as well as our back office. The role offers the opportunity to assist the firm with long-term strategic development in addition to helping our traders with immediate trading decisions. The role will sit alongside, and work closely with our equity Portfolio Finance specialists.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Learn and understand the firm's financing infrastructure.
  • Help build efficiency in securities lending and financing processes across the firm.
  • Assist in the effort to diversify and optimize Jane Street's borrowing resources through the development of strategic efforts and leveraging street-side relationships.
  • Keep the Treasury and Finance teams abreast of any changes in the market or regulatory landscape that require action.
  • Work with the trading desks to assist in putting together trades and trade ideas.
  • Work with the broader team to ensure our partnership with prime brokers is optimized in terms of efficiency and bottom line returns.
  • Work with operations and infrastructure to build reporting and monitoring tools for position-level financing rates.

About You

  • 3+ years of related finance experience in a repo or other fixed income financing role at a sell-side or buy-side firm.
  • An ability to develop and add to relationships with clearing and financing partners (e.g. prime brokers, etc.)
  • VBA, SQL or other programming skills a plus.
  • Self-motivator who can help build a platform capable of supporting our growth.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to learn and understand new trading strategies.
  • Able to work well in a team environment.

We are looking for an experienced hire to support Jane Street's traders with equity finance expertise and to assist our global team with managing our local financing relationships. The role is an entrepreneurial one: the remit is broad in terms of touch points across the firm, and we expect the candidate to be able to work seamlessly with our front office as well as our back office. The role offers the opportunity to assist the firm with long-term strategic development in addition to helping our traders with immediate trading decisions.

About the Position

We are looking to hire a strongly motivated individual who is excited to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment. This person will have experience trading in the power market and is excited to coordinate trading signals with team members. Some responsibilities of this role include:
  • Simulate returns of various strategies in the power market.
  • Model cross commodity correlations and relationships.
  • Execute trades in the power markets.
  • Optimize and improve existing desk strategies.

  • 3+ years experience trading in the power market.

  • Proficiency in statistics.

About the Position

Jane Street is hiring for a global product marketing professional. We are looking for a strong product marketer with experience in financial services/quantitative trading specifically in Fixed Income products. This position touches many parts of our marketing effort, but will be largely content-driven. The ideal candidate will have deep Fixed Income product knowledge and be able to leverage that in this role. Though this role will be focused on providing compelling content to our existing customers, we also expect the person in this position to be able to run print and electronic marketing campaigns, develop client content and presentation materials, and help plan our annual events calendar. Some of the responsibilities of the role are listed below.

Content Management

  • Work with traders, client services, and digital services leads in the US/EU and Asia to develop relevant and compelling product marketing content to be used across multiple mediums (e.g. webpages, client presentations, and digital content).
  • Research and monitor industry research reports, media, and client inquiries in order to anticipate and create innovative content and programming for conferences and speaking engagements.
  • Synthesize and utilize quarterly sales and trading data to produce client presentations.
  • Work with outside vendors to guide and lead top industry surveys and research that Jane Street has historically sponsored.
  • Individual will have the flexibility to create new content strategies and topics and innovate around distribution and external engagement.

Marketing & Distribution

  • Ensure consistency of messaging and data reporting across product marketing materials.
  • Develop strategies and initiatives to increase client engagement and manage the overall client experience across all marketing channels.
  • Review and analyze efficacy of marketing initiatives by monitoring client engagement, assessing conversion metrics, and tracking marketing ROI.

Design & Events

  • Work with internal contacts and outside vendors on graphic design, event planning, and collateral.
  • Maintain brand consistency in every aspect of design and event coordination.

About You

  • Exchange Traded marketplace, investment product knowledge and story-building expertise required .
  • Ability to conceive, direct and execute innovative strategic projects from start to finish.
  • Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills with ability to work across all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong understanding of and ability to interpret and chart financial data.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
  • At least five years marketing experience within the financial services industry or equivalent required, with at least two years’ experience specific to related products.
  • Intermediary or institutional experience preferred.
  • Previous experience that includes direct contact with Salesforce and in-depth knowledge of the sales process preferred.
  • Bachelor’s degree required.
  • Industry specific certificates or licenses preferred.

About the Position

At Jane Street, we consider trading and programming to be two ends of a continuum. As both a trading firm and a tech firm, we have room for people who love to trade, people who love to program, and people everywhere in between. Nearly all of our traders write code, and many of our developers trade. The role you carve out for yourself will be largely dependent on your strengths and the types of problems you enjoy thinking about.

Researchers at Jane Street are responsible for building models, strategies, and systems that price and trade a variety of financial instruments. As a mix of the trading and software developer roles, this work involves many things: analyzing large datasets, building and testing models, creating new trading strategies, and writing the code that implements them.

About You

  • Be able to apply logical and mathematical thinking to all kinds of problems. Asking great questions is more important than knowing all the answers.
  • Write great code. We mostly write in OCaml, so you should want to learn functional programming if you don't already have experience with it.
  • Have good taste in research.The problems we work on rarely have clean, definitive answers. You should be comfortable pushing in new and unknown directions while maintaining clarity of purpose.
  • Think and communicate precisely and openly. We believe great solutions come from the interaction between diverse groups of people across the firm.

About the Position

Our trading is based on our own proprietary models and on busy days we engage in over a million trades. Traders work in teams to seek out and trade on pricing inefficiencies, develop models, manage risk, investigate new products, and push into new business areas. Experienced traders teach and oversee the less-experienced. New traders serve as assistants while they learn the ropes, getting increasing responsibility as they demonstrate their ability to handle it.

Technology is at the core of how we approach trading, and we consider ourselves as much a technology company as a trading firm. We use OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language, and have the largest team of OCaml developers in any industrial setting.

About You

We are looking for people who have a strong quantitative mind and enjoy working collaboratively to solve challenging problems in a practical setting. Prior knowledge of finance or economics is not expected or required. Experience with particular programming languages is also not required, although generally being comfortable programming in your language of choice is a plus.

About the Position

The quantitative trading internship is a fast-paced, immersive experience. Over the course of the summer, you will be mentored by some of our experienced traders who will teach you about identifying, analyzing, and executing trading strategies, constructing quantitative models, conducting statistical analysis, building trading intuition, and more. In addition to 1-on-1 work with your mentors, you will attend internal classes on various topics and participate in mock trading sessions alongside your co-interns, where we can teach you the broader fundamentals of finance and trading (and how your quantitative problem-solving skills fit in). The work can be challenging and intense, but we want our employees, interns included, to have a healthy work-life balance. Interns work approximately 9-hour days, Monday through Friday. We encourage our interns to enjoy their weekends in NYC and to take advantage of what the city has to offer.

About You

We are looking for people who have a strong quantitative mind and enjoy working collaboratively to solve challenging problems in a practical setting. Prior knowledge of finance or economics is not expected or required. Experience with particular programming languages is also not required, although generally being comfortable programming in your language of choice is a plus.

About the Position

About the Position

This is a Regional HR Business Partner position based in our London office, sitting within our Global HR team. The successful candidate will help roll out a global coordinated effort to streamline the overall HR function, as well as working with managers and stakeholders aligning business objectives with HR initiatives.

Responsibilities:

  • Be a strategic partner for the business in thinking through issues related to office growth, maintaining company culture, and enriching the overall employee experience.
  • Provide guidance to managers through coaching and counseling on employee-relation issues.
  • Be an active part of the global HR team through sharing experiences and insight, as well as taking global ideas and make them local where necessary.
  • Collaborate with other HR functions to deal with matters in relation to mobility, recruitment, and compensation & benefits.
  • Be an outlet for employees and navigate any issues that arise. Be able to support the individuals and the business through the proper handling and resolution of any issues.
  • Manage the local HR team.

About You

  • Possess high degree of maturity, professionalism, good judgment, and strong team player mentality.
  • Trustworthy and discreet with the ability to handle all information with the appropriate sensitivity and care.
  • Have the flexibility and open-mindedness to learn and be comfortable with both managing and doing the work yourself.
  • Possess a positive and approachable personality. Being composed, prepared, and balanced in all interactions is essential for success.
  • Good understanding of HR best practices and well-connected in the industry.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to read and understand data to help inform decisions and strategy across the team.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • People management experience.
  • 10+ years of experience.

About the Position

Research Infrastructure Engineer is a position within our Core Services group. The Core Services group has a broad responsibility for the technological foundation on which much of the firm's systems run. This is a specialist role within our group with primary focus on the internal systems (hardware and software) that quantitative researchers at Jane Street use to conduct studies and build models.

A successful Research Infrastructure Engineer will act as a liaison between our Core Services and Research groups, spearheading day-to-day operational responsibility for our research computing cluster, as well as the various support systems that make it tick. You will work closely with quantitative researchers at Jane Street to understand the challenges they face and work with systems engineers in the Core Services group to propose and execute solutions.

About You

To be effective, you will need to understand and reason about all levels of the stack, from top - the job scheduler, libraries and packages in use, data sources, and software written by researchers - to bottom - the physical hardware, storage, and networking.

As a part of the team driving the Linux platform more generally at Jane Street, you will work closely with other members of Core Services and may sometimes be asked to apply your skills and experience in other areas of the estate.

About the Position

The Rotational Development Program (RDP) is designed to prepare you for a key cross-departmental role within the firm. During the program, you will spend structured time in 3-5 sub-groups of Jane Street’s Infrastructure Group. These sub-groups include compliance, finance, settlements, risk, and more.

During each of your rotations, you will be working on projects that help you understand each group’s fundamental functions as well as its role within the firm. These projects include:

  • Analyzing data from various sources and communicating relevant findings to different internal groups.
  • Identifying bottlenecks in existing processes and implementing solutions to streamline them.
  • Integrating new business initiatives into our operational, regulatory, and technical infrastructure.

The role includes a mix of project management and rolling up your sleeves, with a goal of helping you develop a comprehensive understanding of Jane Street’s business.

If this position sounds interesting but you're looking for an internship opportunity please consider our Business Development Internship, listed under our open Infrastructure positions.

About You

While we don’t expect you to have a background in any specific field, we are looking for smart people who enjoy solving difficult problems. You should:

  • Have the aptitude for developing a broad range of technical skills, e.g., querying databases, understanding and writing computer code.
  • Be comfortable comprehending high-level concepts, including technical, financial, legal, etc.; applying the concepts to make informed, concrete decisions; and taking the necessary steps to ensure those decisions are executed.
  • Be proactive and self-motivated with strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Be a reliable, courteous, and flexible team player.

About the position

We are looking for an experienced network engineer to join our New York team, which is currently designing and deploying new network topology to support the firm's Global trading environment. These updates will form the foundation of our next-generation trading platform. Its flexibility, and performance are critical for the firm’s continued success.
Our network is a key part of our competitive advantage, which gives the networking team a significant role in the overall firm. We want to give you a meaningful role quickly. Our network handles many millions of messages, shepherding billions of dollars every day. We want you to take that responsibility personally and seriously.

Any candidate hired will play a significant role in the next stage of Jane Street’s development. We hope to find someone who can grow to assume network lead status for one of our Europe, Asia, or North America regions.

About you

Requirements:

  • Recent hands-on experience deploying and maintaining networks for a company where the network is central to its operations.
  • Solid automation and administration skills: – Comfortable on a standard UNIX command line – Fluent in one or more scripting languages (Python, bash, etc.).

Non-Requirements:

  • No experience in the financial industry needed.
  • No specific vendor/technology experience required.

About the Position

We're always hiring software engineers for all three of our offices. Technology is at the core of how we approach that work and engineers are intimately tied in to every area of the business.

We are big believers in functional programming, using OCaml, a statically-typed functional programming language, as our primary development language. We also believe in the value of open source software, using it in our daily work and releasing hundreds of thousands of lines of our own code as open source.

About You

  • Top-notch programming skills.
  • Deep experience with—and love for—technology. There’s no specific checklist; we use software to approach a variety of problems, so we’re interested in everything from machine learning to systems administration to programming language design.
  • Strong interpersonal skills. Software engineering at Jane Street is highly collaborative, and we are looking for people who can work effectively in small, close-knit teams.

We don’t expect you to have experience with functional programming, OCaml, or finance; we’re happy to hire talented engineers and teach them what they need to know.

If you'd like to get an idea of what we cover in our software engineering interview process, you can read our recent blog post, and to get an idea of projects software engineering interns work on you can read this article from Summer 2018.

  • Deep experience with—and love for—technology. There’s no specific checklist; we use software to approach a variety of problems, so we’re interested in everything from machine learning to systems administration to programming language design.
  • Strong interpersonal skills. Software engineering at Jane Street is highly collaborative, and we are looking for people who can work effectively in small, close-knit teams.

We don’t expect you to have experience with functional programming, OCaml, or finance; we’re happy to hire talented engineers and teach them what they need to know.

About the Position

Networked storage infrastructure is a critical service backing many production systems and workflows at Jane Street. A highly technical Storage Engineer will help out with the day-to-day work of administering the storage infrastructure in our production environment (which might involve everything from debugging bugs in the Linux kernel’s NFS client, to projecting future capacity requirements). Someone in this role would also be charged with making sure our storage environment advances with the developing needs of our users.

A candidate for this role should have strong foundations in common storage technologies and protocols, but need not have knowledge of any particular platform. The ideal candidate would be as comfortable working with a “black box” vendor NAS as they are standing up a Ceph cluster for a proof of concept or writing a benchmark suite for ZFS. Some programming ability would be helpful since we love to automate our work, and you should be at ease diving into the source code of some misbehaving application to figure out why it’s tickling a performance bug on our production storage cluster.

About You

  • Strong background in storage fundamentals, probably formed from experience working with a number of different vendor and open-source storage platforms.
  • Clear and concise communication skills, as well as the ability to efficiently analyze and deconstruct technical problems (also, you should enjoy digging into hard problems).
  • Solid practical understanding of a modern Linux system, as well as a grounding in common network technologies.
  • Some background in modern systems architecture also a plus.
  • Nimble at a Unix command-line, including working familiarity with a scripting language like Bash or Perl.

About the Position

Jane Street is looking for a Strategic Communications Specialist to join our growing business. The successful candidate will cultivate strong working relationships throughout the firm, industry, financial community and media. In this role, you will develop knowledge of the firm’s business and global trading landscape while monitoring, measuring and reporting all media coverage of Jane Street.

Responsibilities:

  • Contribute to the creation of external communications content.
  • Preparing consistent messaging documents.
  • Research, outline, edit and proofread materials for external use.
  • Work with vendors and in house design team on special projects such as creating videos and other marketing materials.
  • Compile media reports; draft briefing notes and communications plans.
  • Work with communications agency in its day-to-day efforts on behalf of the firm.

About You

  • Collaborative team player who thrives in a fast paced environment.
  • 6-8 years relevant experience.
  • The ability to understand and write clearly about technical subjects.
  • Experience within financial services.
  • Strong attention to detail.

About the Position

In this role, you will help manage the operational side of the trading desk’s activities and interact with various internal groups and external parties. You will gain an in-depth understanding of the flow of the trading and settlement cycle, as well as the regulatory and operational considerations of each step. Traders will rely on you to monitor trading tools, manage and update complex spreadsheets, optimize existing processes and develop new tools for the desk. As you become more familiar with the day-to-day operations of the desk it’s expected that you’ll dedicate an increasing amount of time to the coding and development functions.

About You

  • A strong quantitative foundation.
  • Exposure to programming, and an interest in expanding your technical skills.
  • Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills, along with a detail-oriented mindset. We don’t look for one specific background; we’re interested in hiring effective communicators who can think critically and strive for continuous improvement.
  • The ability to prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
  • Intellectual curiosity and a willingness to learn.

About the Position

This position will be within the Trading Systems group at Jane Street's New York office. The role involves a mix of operational and project-oriented work. The operational side of the job is focused on a support rotation where engineers are responsible for monitoring the health of Jane Street’s trading infrastructure and working with the trading desks and the other technology groups to understand and react to issues as they arise during the trading day. Quick thinking and effective communication are important parts of this job.

When not on the support rotation, engineers work on projects to improve the trading infrastructure, such as:

  • Working with the Trading Systems developers to write code for Jane Street's trading infrastructure.
  • Writing code to improve the stack of tools and systems for managing, monitoring and configuring Jane Street’s trading infrastructure.
  • Working with exchanges and brokers to onboard trading on new venues or in new products.
  • Improving our systems administration tools and practices.
  • Extending and improving the documentation of our systems and procedures.

About You

  • Comfort operating in a Unix environment.
  • Professional experience in software development and/or systems administration.
  • Strong debugging and troubleshooting instincts.
  • A sense of responsibility, ownership, and urgency.
  • The ability to perform and prioritize under pressure.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Attention to detail.

About the Position

We are looking to hire a strongly motivated individual who is excited to work in a fast paced, collaborative environment. This person in this role will have experience forecasting temperatures, rainfall, and storm trajectory/intensity and how that impacts commodities prices. We are looking for someone who can continuously provide updated weather information as part of a commodities trading desk and to explain these updates to those without a weather background.

About You

  • Bachelor's degree in Meteorology or related field.
  • Strong forecasting skills with the ability to demonstrate accuracy.
  • Must be able to work in a fast-paced team environment.
  • Must have a familiarity with programming languages.

About the Position

We are looking for a strong Web Developer and Animator to join our marketing team. Our ideal candidate is proficient in HTML, CSS, SVG animation and familiar with JavaScript. We are looking for a candidate who is comfortable writing their own code and is meticulous about it. The Web Developer will work on parts of our corporate website, microsites, one-off digital campaigns and videos.

This is a hands-on Web Developer role with a lot of room to be creative. This is a position for someone who is excited about marketing and technology and will present new and better ways for us to develop our digital recruiting and marketing efforts.

Our Web Developer should be interested in technology that will improve our marketing efforts and work to make sure we add creative flair to digital projects and presentations.

The culture at Jane Street is collaborative and we always want to hear ideas.

About You

Qualifications:

  • At least 3 years professional experience.
  • Proactive and self-motivated with strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Positive, professional attitude and presence.
  • Animation portfolio (link available, please include this in your resume).

Proficiency in the following:

  • HTML and CSS.
  • Basic JavaScript.
  • Implementing responsive websites.
  • Strong proficiency in SVG/CSS animation.
  • Source control.
  • Dynamic HTML generation (e.g. template authoring).
  • Optimizing asset delivery (preprocessing, minification, compression, etc.).
  • Best practices in frontend web security.
  • Familiarity with the following would be beneficial: Adobe suite, motion graphics, video, Jekyll (or other similar static site generator), basic graphic design.

About the Position

Microsoft Windows is an important technology for Jane Street. It is our primary desktop operating system and many key core infrastructure services are provided by Windows servers. Members of the Windows team work with others in the broader Systems group to monitor, manage and maintain our mixed environment of Linux and Windows, across a physical and virtual computing landscape on three continents.

As a Windows developer you will be responsible for developing and maintaining tools and applications related to user and group administration, hardware/software inventory, operating system builds, software deployment, system monitoring, auditing/reporting, and enhancing trader productivity. In addition to writing code, you will also be responsible for the entire development life-cycle of each project. This includes meeting with stakeholders to gather requirements, development, testing, documentation, support, and incorporating enhancements or new features based on stakeholder feedback.

We use a variety of platforms and programming languages for developing and maintaining our trading environment. Teamwork is paramount at Jane Street, so you should be excited about sharing your work with others. We enjoy the challenge and diversity encountered each day. You will get exposure to multiple segments of our business and will work with our trading desks and international offices on a daily basis. Sometimes the work is intense, but it is always rewarding. We seek talented people and provide them with the tools to succeed with a great company.

About You

  • 4+ years writing code in a .NET Language, in particular, GUI applications (WPF preferred), windows services, web services (ASP.NET Web API preferred).
  • Must be willing to learn F# and write functional code.
  • Proficient in writing/maintaining PowerShell scripts.
  • Understanding of Key Windows Server technologies, especially IIS.
  • Experience designing MSSQL DB schemas for use with Entity Framework.
  • Proficient understanding of version control (Mercurial preferred).

Desirable Skills

  • Experience with F# or other functional languages.
  • Data serialization (JSON.net preferred).
  • Experience with web development (HTML, JavaScript, JQuery, CSS).
  • Familiar with MVVM.
  • Optimization/Profiling of code.

About the Position

Microsoft Windows is an important technology for Jane Street. It is our primary desktop operating system and many key core infrastructure services are provided by Windows servers. Members of the Windows team work with others in the broader Systems group to monitor, manage and maintain our mixed environment of Linux and Windows, across a physical and virtual computing landscape on three continents.

As a Windows Systems Administrator you will be responsible for the whole Windows infrastructure from Active Directory and DNS to more complex issues in the Windows Desktop environment, all of which is critical for the continuity of the business. Time will be spent improving, automating and standardizing the environment – finding issues and proposing improvements, communicating amongst the rest of the local team in your region and abroad, planning and executing deployments.

We use a variety of platforms and programming languages for developing and maintaining our trading environment. Teamwork is paramount at Jane Street, so you should be excited about sharing your work with others. We enjoy the challenge and diversity encountered on each day. You will get exposure to multiple segments of our business and will work with our trading desks and international offices on a daily basis. Sometimes the work is intense, but it is always rewarding. We seek talented people and provide them with the tools to succeed with a great company.

About You

  • 5+ years’ experience and knowledge of inner workings of Microsoft Windows 7/10 and Server 2012 R2/2016.
  • Advanced working knowledge of Active Directory/DHCP/DNS/Group Policy.
  • Experience with hardware monitoring and performance tuning.
  • Create and maintain PowerShell scripts.
  • Troubleshoot, analyse and solve technical issues in a fast-paced environment.
  • Clear and concise communication skills.
  • Maintain a high degree of customer service for all support queries.
  • Clearly document problem resolution using our online knowledge base.
  • Troubleshoot workstation operating systems, applications, peripherals, network and audio-visual issues.
